page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY OF FORDYCE
page.content:
PLACES OF INTEREST
The remains of the 16th Century Church and Churchyard of St.Tarquin have been repaired and vaults and canopied tombs restored.Ivy,moss and other vegetation had to be cleared away to reveal lettering,coats of arms, etc.,and a new roof has been put on the Abercromby Vault which contains a marble monument.The chamber above the great porch,with the village prison beneath,has been restored and the bell from the ancient belfry has been recast and now peals from the new church.The last burial in the old cemetery was in 1965,although ashes were brought from a cremation in Canada and were laid there in 1976. The new cemetery was first used in 1921 and both are kept attractive by the local gravedigger and 2 assistants
